results.title: Times have changed
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Lillian Murray and ACMI
results.brief_description: Lillian Murray has worked in the offices of Legacy in Melbourne’s CBD for the last 29 years. It is her home away from home and she reflects on the technological changes there as well as the good times and the great people she has the pleasure to work with.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Lillian Murray and ACMI

results.title: 1946 : my first year nursing
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Jean Cussen and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Jean Cussen’s father returned from the war, she took up nursing at the Children’s Hospital in Carlton. She provides, in rich detail, her time there, the children she cared for and how caring for these poor children brought the staff so much pleasure.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Jean Cussen and ACMI

results.title: A Dose of reality
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Andrew Dobbyn and ACMI
results.brief_description: Andrew Dobbyn feels he has lived a privileged life. A baby boomer with a war veteran father, Dobbyn’s family did what they could to help the wives and children of those who didn’t return from the war. Despite this, Dobbyn felt he could be doing more and highlights two events in his life that showed him just how lucky he is.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Andrew Dobbyn and ACMI
results.description: Andrew Dobbyn feels he has lived a privileged life. results.title: BMX is life
results.creator_credit: Harley Van Belkolm, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Riding and doing tricks on his BMX is when Harley Van Belkolm feels free. He provides some insight into this passion of his, the culture that surrounds it and why he wouldn’t be doing anything else.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Harley Van Belkolm, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Street kids
results.creator_credit: Dmitry Schukin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: From Russia to Werribee, via the gangs of Los Angeles and Las Vegas, Dmitry Schukin’s story is one of redemption through art. He talks openly about the crimes of his past and the pursuits that have helped him channel all the negative into something positive and given Schukin something to fight for.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dmitry Schukin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: From Russia to Werribee, via the gangs of Los Angeles and Las Vegas, Dmitry Schukin’s story is one of redemption through art. He talks openly about the crimes of his past and the pursuits that have helped him channel all the negative into something positive and given Schukin something to fight for.

He talks openly about the crimes of his past and the pursuits that have helped him channel all the negative into something positive and given Schukin something to fight for.

results.title: Just say no
results.creator_credit: Christiana Dumitru, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Christiana Dumitru’s father died and her family had to move, she turned to a partying lifestyle. Hooked on drugs at an alarmingly young age, Dumitru reflects on the strength of will she had to summon to get back on track and the friends and family she has learnt to value.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christiana Dumitru, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Life will never be the same
results.creator_credit: Amanda Jurisic, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: ‘You don’t need to jump on a plane, or go to a theme park or stay at a five star hotel to experience the beautiful things in life.’ Amanda Jurisic remembers her father’s legacy : a sense of adventure and a love of travel. The values he taught her have stayed with her, and inspired her to travel the world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Amanda Jurisic, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: ‘You don’t need to jump on a plane, or go to a theme park or stay at a five star hotel to experience the beautiful things in life.’ Amanda Jurisic remembers her father’s legacy : a sense of adventure and a love of travel. The values he taught her have stayed with her, and inspired her to travel the world.

results.title: An Interview with Wes Bailey
results.brief_description: With a vibrant sense of humour, Wes Bailey recounts his various postings as a signaller during World War II. Long hot days of being eaten alive by mozzies as well as the expected pleasures of fruit and vegetables have nothing on the most significant posting of Bailey’s career, as husband to fellow signaller Phil Bailey.
results.description: With a vibrant sense of humour, Wes Bailey recounts his various postings as a signaller during World War II. Long hot days of being eaten alive by mozzies as well as the expected pleasures of fruit and vegetables have nothing on the most significant posting of Bailey’s career, as husband to fellow signaller Phil Bailey.

results.title: An Interview with Phil Bailey
results.brief_description: Phil Bailey was a telegrapher - one of a unique cohort of women who were trained in signalling by a forward-thinking female engineer. She has never forgotten morse code due to the wise words of her teacher.
results.description: Phil Bailey was a telegrapher - one of a unique cohort of women who were trained in signalling by a forward-thinking female engineer. She has never forgotten morse code due to the wise words of her teacher.

results.title: An Interview with Joyce Bryan
results.brief_description: Joyce Bryan was a witness to the return of the Prisoners of War from Japan. She provides an powerful and detailed rendering of the emotionally charged return and the struggles of the men to fit back into society.
results.description: Joyce Bryan was a witness to the return of the Prisoners of War from Japan. She provides an powerful and detailed rendering of the emotionally charged return and the struggles of the men to fit back into society.
